alert.note: Alert for Carter; Cleveland; Garvin; Hughes; Johnston; Lincoln; Marshall; McClain; Murray; Oklahoma; Pontotoc; Pottawatomie; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 1:20PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Johnston, Garvin, southeastern Oklahoma, Lincoln, Pontotoc, north central Marshall, southeastern McClain, Seminole, central Carter, eastern Cleveland, Murray, Pottawatomie and western Hughes Counties through 200 PM CDT... At 120 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Warwick to near Etowah to near Tatums. Movement was east at 65 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southeastern Norman, Shawnee, Ardmore, Ada, Seminole, Tecumseh, Pauls Valley, Holdenville, Sulphur, Chandler, Davis, Harrah, McLoud, Wewoka, Stroud, Prague, Wynnewood, Pink, Stratford, and Konawa. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 38 and 86. Interstate 40 between mile markers 171 and 212. Interstate 44 between mile markers 154 and 182. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Carter; Cleveland; Garvin; Hughes; Johnston; Lincoln; Marshall; McClain; Murray; Oklahoma; Pontotoc; Pottawatomie; Seminole
